scalf.cmsc335.finalProject.threaded

Class TrafficLight

  • java.lang.Object
    • scalf.cmsc335.finalProject.threaded.TrafficItem
      • scalf.cmsc335.finalProject.threaded.TrafficLight
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TrafficLight
extends TrafficItem
    Simulation of a traffic light. Changes between green, yellow, and red, while staying on green the longest.
    Author:
    Samuel Scalf
    Date:
    10 OCT 2020
    School:
    University of Maryland Global Campus
    Professor:
    Dr. Osama A. Morad, Ph.D.
    Course:
    CMSC 335 6380 Object-Oriented and Concurrent Programming (2208)

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrafficLight

        public TrafficLight(double mult,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    java.lang.String imageName,
                    Synchronizer sync)
        Full constructor. Calls constructor required by TrafficItem.
        Parameters:
        mult - the timing offset of this TrafficLight
        x - the starting horizontal position of this TrafficLight
        y - the starting vertical position of this TrafficLight
        imageName - the filepath for this TrafficLight's image
        sync - the Synchronizer for this thread

      • TrafficLight

        public TrafficLight(int x,
                    int y,
                    java.lang.String imageName,
                    Synchronizer sync)
        Constructor required by TrafficItem. Sets the starting Light enum value.
        Parameters:
        x - the starting horizontal position of this TrafficItem
        y - the starting vertical position of this TrafficItem
        imageName - the filepath for this TrafficLight's image
        sync - the Synchronizer for this thread

    • Method Detail

      • setLight

        private void setLight(java.lang.String imageName)
        Sets the Light value based on the image.
        Parameters:
        imageName - the filepath for this TrafficLight's image

      • changeLight

        private void changeLight()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Changes the current Light and Image for this TrafficLight and waits for the delay.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • isRed

        public boolean isRed()
        Returns whether or not the light is red.
        Returns:
        boolean of whether Light is RED or not

      • run

        public void run()
        The main process of this Thread. Continuously loops until either cancelled or stopped. This checks for paused twice, because the long delays when changing the light were sometimes messing with the lights pausing properly.
